page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY OAKWOOD,SHROPS
page.content: The ancient farmhouse of Oakwood appears to be within a circular enclosure and we are waiting for the crisp clear autumn weather for the Shropshire field Archaeologist to fly over for a closer inspection. There is plenty of evidence of mediaeval ridge and furrow fields and another square considered worth closer investigation is 0S 552952 at Lushcott.This whole area is on a line from the known Roman Villa at Acton Scott to the one at Harley. This is an on-going project and will continue; who knows what lies beneath the soil awaiting discovery?
